page.title: 06Ecology of the Bromley Area
page.content: {Open areas considered} Chislehurst Golf Course Sundridge Park Golf Course Railway embankments Jubilee Park, Bromley {Vegetation} Mixed woodland, mostly oak and silver birch,with some ash,sweet chestnut, horse chestnut,sycamore,Scotts pine, lime and willow.Elm,the trees killed by Dutch elm disease,now regenerating as scrub. Other sub-species-hawthorn,gorse holly,dog rose and elderberry. Wide stretches of grass-cut on golf courses, uncut in Jubilee Park. {Mammals} Foxes breed regularly at several sites; they feed mostly on domestic refuse as "dustbin foxes". Woodmice,bank voles and grey squirrels are common throughout. Bats are seen occasionally.
